page.title: 04VISIT TO GIBSON'S FARM
page.content: We left school, crossed Halifax Road, and walked down the hillside through Sutcliffe Wood and into the valley. We saw horses in the stables at Sutcliffe Wood Farm. We crossed a stream called Red Beck, then walked up a steep hill. We passed G R Stein's brickworks, and at the top of the hill was the farm. Two ladies met us there, Mrs Gibson and her friend Mrs Robinson. They gave us all a drink, then showed us round. They keep cattle, horses and pigs; goats, chickens and geese. They grow no crops, except hay to feed the animals in winter. They also have three dogs, to help control the other animals. Mr Gibson has a full-time job apart from the farm, and so Mrs Gibson does most of the work running it.
